simpoppit.gameboard
Class GameInterface

java.lang.Object
  simpoppit.gameboard.GameInterface
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable
public class GameInterface
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable

Title: GameInterface

Description: The game interface class provides the means to initialize a poppit game and play it through, exposing available moves, modifying the board in response to moves made, and making sure that the game rules are followed and the board state remains consistent. This is the class that should be used by any player of Poppit to invoke and interact with a Poppit game instance. This class makes heavy use of the GameGrid.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2005

Version:
1.0
Author:
Andrew W. Henry
See Also:
GameGrid

Constructor Detail

GameInterface

public GameInterface()
Default constructor: creates a default-sized game grid and initializes it.

See Also:
GameInterface(int, int)

GameInterface

public GameInterface(int aX,
                     int aY)
Constructor: creates an arbitrary-sized Poppit game instance

Parameters:
aX - integer number of rows for the game grid
aY - integer number of columns for the game grid

GameInterface

private GameInterface(GameGrid newGrid,
                      int aScore)
Constructor: this contructor is used by the clone method to propogate the accumulated score as well as avoid clearing the list of game event listeners. The score could be computed, but since it is readily at hand and we have a dedicated constructor anyway, might as well just pass it and save the processor time.

Parameters:
newGrid - an existing game grid to use for this new game instance
aScore -

getScore

public int getScore()
getScore: Returns the value of the current score for this game instance.

Returns:
current integer score

getMaxScore

public int getMaxScore()
getMaxScore: Returns the maximum possible score for this game instance. This score may not be attainable, and represents only the score that could be achieved if the board was completely solvable (i.e. all the balloon could ultimately be popped).

Returns:
integer maximum score

resetGame

public void resetGame()
resetGame: Returns the game state to initial settings. Does not revert to original game grid layout, but generates a new one of the same size. Sends an "update" event to all registered listeners.

valueOfMove

public int valueOfMove(Coord aBalloon)
valueOfMove: Returns the score value of the move represented by the given location. That is, if the given location was popped (assuming it is eligible), how much that move would increase the score of this game.

Parameters:
aBalloon - Coordinate of balloon/grid location of interest
Returns:
integer score value of move

gameOver

public boolean gameOver()
gameOver: Returns true if there are no more moves left in this game, false otherwise. Note: probable optimization opportunity

Returns:
boolean

pop

public boolean pop(Coord aBalloon)
pop: Given a balloon/grid location, pop the balloon at that location if eligible, and take care of other tasks necessary to maintain game integrity after a move takes place (squeezing columns and rows, notifying registered listeners, etc). Return true if the pop was successful, false if not.

Parameters:
aBalloon - Coordinate of balloon/grid location desired to pop
Returns:
boolean

popAll

public void popAll()
popAll: Pop all eligible balloons in the current game. This is not a legal action, but is a cheat added for troubleshooting purposes to quickly pop multiple balloons and finish a game rapidly.

highlight

public void highlight(Coord aBalloon)
highlight: Given a balloon/grid location, if it contains a balloon that is eligible to be popped, send the "highlight" game event to that balloon and all other balloons in the same balloon group (like-colored and adjacent).

Parameters:
aBalloon - Coordinate of the balloon to potentially highlight

unHighlight

public void unHighlight(Coord aBalloon)
unHighlight: Given a balloon/grid location, send the "unhighlight" game event to that balloon and all other balloons in the same balloon group (like-colored and adjacent).

Parameters:
aBalloon - Coordinate of the balloon to unhighlight

public void addGameListener(GameListener listener)
addGameListener: Register a class to allow it to receive event notifications when the game state changes.

Parameters:
listener - a class that implements the GameListener interface
